pageContext.title: In brief: JD.com CEO cleared of sexual assault charges in the US
pageContext.content:
To get more news and analysis like this from Tech In Asia in your inbox, sign up for our free newsletter here.

JD.com CEO Richard Liu will not be charged in connection with a sexual assault investigation in the US, ending a probe that had cast doubt over the company’s leadership. Liu, who was participating in a University of Minnesota program for executives, was arrested in late August after being accused of raping a 21-year-old female Chinese undergraduate student. The potential charges had wiped out about US$15 billion of JD.com’s market value – almost a third of its capitalization.

Source: Bloomberg
